thread.title_full: London was hotter than Ibiza but temperatures are about to fall | London - ITV News

title: London was hotter than Ibiza but temperatures are about to fall | London - ITV News
text:
21 February 2017 at 10:38am London was hotter than Ibiza but temperatures are about to fall 
Temperatures hit 18.3C on Monday as London basked in the warmest day of the year so far - beating the likes of Ibiza, southern Spain and the whole of France. The sun sets behind Canary Wharf Credit: PA 
The temperature was recorded at Kew Gardens, west London, where visitors enjoyed temperatures 10 degrees warmer than Milan at 8C. 
Northolt, north west London, also recorded 18.3C, which marks the warmest day of the winter so far. Heathrow Airport saw 18.1C. 
Nicola Maxey, a Met Office spokeswoman, said the balmy temperatures were caused by tropical Atlantic air sweeping across the country. 
From Tuesday temperatures start dropping - much more near the average temperature for the time of year. – Nicola Maxey, Met Office 
She added that by the end of the week temperatures could be closer to single figures, with London expected to reach. Last updated Tue 21 Feb 2017
